subject: Re: [junit] Re: ANN: "Unit Testing in Java" available
msgSnippet: ... Go to http://www.bhusa.com/mk, search for Unit Testing in Java and follow the links. ... No Ant stuff in there. JUnit is covered to the point a standard
messageBody:
> Great. I had B&N order one last night so I could look it over. Is
> there a table of contents available for it somewhere? I checked a
> handful of sites and the description was a little vague.

Go to http://www.bhusa.com/mk, search for "Unit Testing in Java" and follow
the links.

>Just
> wondering how in-depth it covers JUnit and if it touches on Ant,
> Cactus, JUnitPref, HttpUnit, etc.

No Ant stuff in there. JUnit is covered to the point a "standard user" needs
it. The other tools play a role, but you won't find in-depth explanation
about installation, API reference etc. The book's main purpose is to show what
tests to write and what tests to leave out. The (constantly changing)
technical details of JUnit add-ons is left to the Web which can much faster adapt to
changes and new versions.

Johannes
